course_title: Special Topics: QTM: SimulationStat. Methods Python
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 20 / Seats Avail: 16Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Prerequisites: [QTM 220 or ECON 320], QTM 110, QTM 150, [QTM 210 or ECON 220 or MATH 362], [MATH 210 or MATH 211], and MATH 221, prior Python experience recommended.)
(Permission Required Prior to Enrollment)
(Permission code request form (same for all QTM courses): http://bit.ly/Fall2021-QTM)
(This class introduces examples where simulation can be used 1) to perform hypothesis testing, 2) to evaluate and compare different methods/estimators, and 3) to estimate the parameters of interest.)
course_description: Special Topics Courses. Includes Game Theory I/II, Maximum Likelihood Estimation, Longitudinal Data Analysis, Experimental Methods, Survey Research Methods, Computational Modeling, and Advanced Topics: Bayesian Statistics.
prerequisites: QTM 110 and QTM 120 and QTM 210 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
schedule_location: F 8am-11am in Math & Science Center - N304
sections: Class Nbr: 1489, Section #: 6, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: F 8-11a, Instructor: S. Rho, Status: Open
